column4: what do you mean you're always in the sudo file? you mean you log in as root?
loder: what are you up to?
loder: why don't you just boot from the cd and install it that way?
loder: what was the error. i don't think you told us before
loder: we can't help if you don't tell us what the problem was
loder: pastebin the file
never realized that would work in pidgin...
I'll have to go save the file first
have you tried booting from the cd (not into ubuntu or windows) and installing from there?
there is a limit on the number of primary partitions you can have on a disk
furthermore, if you're trying to let it autoconfigure grub, it'll try to make a primary partition for the boot stuff, afaik. try to point it to your existing /boot
no, but you know, i find that it's always nice to have a clean partition table
have you tried making logical volumes?
you wouldn't hit that primary partition limit with logical volumes
do you mean you're chain loading grub through the vista bootloader?
do you see grub when you boot your computer?
so grub is the linux bootloader, and it's located in /boot
the windows one would say "Windows Boot Manager" at the top
properly configured, grub will display something like 'Ubuntu' 'Fedora' and 'Windows Vista'
yes but that would eradicate your linux installations
sudo apt-get install gparted if you don't have it
no problem. try the man pages for help on the appropriate flag to look for extended/primary. run man gparted
